location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 6: Ephraim Gerrish Stannus, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to Government, Bombay

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: This folio has suffered damage at the edges, which has resulted in some of the text being lost.

mods.abstract: Ephraim Gerrish Stannus, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, transmits a copy of a letter (not included) from Major Willock, which includes a translation of a royal firman addressed to the Governor General of Fars. Stannus states that it is not clear whether the firman, which prohibits the imposition of any new duties on horses or other property belonging to British subjects, has been authorised by the Persian Government. Stannus goes on to express his regret that he is unable to provide a copy of another firman, which was referred to in Captain John MacLeod's letter.
